newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Tuesday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover fell sharply to 1.233 billion yuan from 2.559 billion yuan with the 90-day contract the most actively traded.

Traders said trading was dull on the first-tier market with all members, head offices of state-run banks and short-term financial centres and money brokerages run by the central bank, traded less on a lack of market-moving news.
"Most state banks have ample money supply these days and this has seen trading volume fall in the past few days," one trader said.

But on the second-tier market, where non-financial institutions including securities houses trade through the short-term financial centres, trading was active with the boutyant stock markets increasing money demand, traders said.
"Securities houses have been the most active traders on the second-tier market in recent weeks," a second trader said.
Traders said they expected the rates to move around the current level in the next few days.
